title: New Aria club Jewel to open next spring
text:
New Aria club Jewel to open next spring New Aria club Jewel to open next spring 
(Courtesy photo) By Mike Weatherford  
Talk of the next Jewel of the nightclub scene won't be a mere descriptive, or a pop-turned-country singer, but the actual name of the Aria nightclub replacing the bygone Haze. 
The Hakkasan Group announced Wednesday that the renamed and remodeled club will open next spring as a partnership with MGM Resorts International and Dubai World. 
Jewel will be about 24,000 square feet with a capacity of 1,925. The company's flagship nightclub, Hakkasan at the MGM Grand, is 80,000 square feet. 
The new club is designed by The Rockwell Group, headed by David Rockwell, a firm with work on display at several places on the Strip, including The Cosmopolitan and its Marquee club. It will be a multi-level venue with a mezzanine and five "unique and secluded suites above the dance floor, each with its own exclusive entry," according to today's announcement. 
It also promises "a first-of-its-kind production wall featuring dual-sided LED video screens and special effects lighting, also allowing for 360-degree movement." 
Haze was operated by The Light Group and closed almost a year ago, in the wake of pimping and prostitution allegations. The club was the origin of a confrontation that led to the 2013 shooting of Kenny "Clutch" Cherry on the Strip and the death of a taxi driver and passenger struck by Cherry's vehicle.
